dt.t: "… he is a polished gentleman, a citizen of the world—yes, a true {wi}cosmopolite{/wi}…"

dt: {bc}an organism found in most parts of the world and under varied ecological conditions {bc}a cosmopolitan organism

dt.t: A few of these kinds of oysters had and have a wide distribution around the world. One such {wi}cosmopolite{/wi} is the tropical P. hyotis, as far-flung in habitat as coral reefs and usually found in conjunction with them, in the Indian Ocean, the south Pacific, the Caribbean, the west coast of Africa, etc.

et: New Latin {it}cosmopolites{/it}, from Greek {it}kosmopolitēs{/it}, from {it}kosmos{/it} + {it}politēs{/it} citizen
shortdef: a sophisticated, widely traveled person : a cosmopolitan person
an organism found in most parts of the world and under varied ecological conditions : a cosmopolitan organism
